description: Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz has faced criticism for his response to the public unrest in his state after George Floyd's murder in Minneapolis in 2020. CBS News Confirmed mapped out how long it took Walz to bring in the National Guard during the outrage. CBS News Minnesota reporter Jennifer Mayerle explains the findings.
title: Investigating timeline of when Tim Walz called in National Guard amid George Floyd unrest

description: Former President Donald Trump reacted to the Iran launching missiles toward Israel, an attack that Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu called a failure. CBS News congressional correspondent Nikole Killion reports on Trump's reaction ahead of the vice presidential debate.
title: Trump reacts to Iranian missile attack against Israel

description: Amit Patel, who is serving 6 1/2 years, filed a lawsuit claiming that FanDuel ignored its own responsible gambling and anti-money laundering protocols.
title: Ex-Jaguars employee who stole from team sues FanDuel for $250 million

description: Vice President Kamala Harris will be featured by "60 Minutes" on Monday, Oct. 7 at 8 p.m. ET/PT. Former President Donald Trump has declined to participate, despite previously indicating otherwise.
title: Harris to be interviewed, Trump declines "60 Minutes" election special

description: Sen. JD Vance and Democratic Gov. Tim Walz are facing off tonight in the CBS News vice presidential debate in New York.
title: VP debate live updates from Walz and Vance's 2024 showdown

description: Typically, debates are held in battleground or key primary states. Ohio Sen. JD Vance and Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz will face off in the only scheduled vice presidential debate, hosted by CBS News, on Tuesday night in New York City. CBS News political director Fin Gómez discusses why the debate's location is unique and CBS News chief White House correspondent Nancy Cordes analyzes winning debate strategies.
title: What to watch for in Walz-Vance VP debate in New York City

description: Former President Donald Trump's running mate turned to a Minnesota Republican to help him prepare for Tuesday night's debate. Rep. Tom Emmer worked with Sen. JD Vance as a stand-in for Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz. Emmer joins "America Decides" to discuss his role in the debate prep process.
title: Rep. Tom Emmer on standing in as Tim Walz for JD Vance's debate prep

description: The first and likely only vice presidential debate between Sen. JD Vance and Gov. Tim Walz will be held at the CBS Broadcast Center.
title: What to know about the CBS debate stage

description: Iran launched a missile attack against Israel on Tuesday. The Israeli military said there would be consequences for the strikes. CBS News senior foreign correspondent Elizabeth Palmer has the latest from Tel Aviv.
title: Netanyahu says Iran made "big mistake" by attacking Israel

description: The CBS News Confirmed team will fact-check Tuesday night's vice presidential debate online in real-time. CBS News chief Washington correspondent Major Garrett explains how the process works.
title: How CBS News is fact-checking the Vance-Walz VP debate

description: Ohio Sen. JD Vance and Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz are preparing to go head to head in their first and only scheduled debate Tuesday night. CBS News senior White House and political correspondent Ed O'Keefe and CBS News political correspondent Caitlin Huey-Burns report from the spin room on the expectations and preparations. CBS News' executive director of elections and surveys Anthony Salvanto breaks down what voters are expecting from the vice presidential debate.
title: How JD Vance's and Tim Walz's debate preparations differ from each other

description: One of the two vice presidential candidates taking the debate stage Tuesday night was largely unknown to voters outside of Minnesota before joining the Democratic ticket. But even since then, many Americans might still be wondering: Who is Gov. Tim Walz? CBS News Minnesota reporter and anchor Esme Murphy explains.
title: Who is Tim Walz? What to know before VP debate with JD Vance

description: Ohio Sen. JD Vance and Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz will face off in the first and only scheduled vice presidential debate on CBS News Tuesday night. CBS News chief election and campaign correspondent Robert Costa reports on how former President Donald Trump will be watching and what he expects from his running mate.
title: What Trump expects from Vance during VP debate

description: Thousands of East and Gulf Coast dockworkers are on strike and demanding higher pay. Here's how much they earn.
title: How much do striking dockworkers make? Here are their salaries.

description: AM Radio for Every Vehicle Act would require AM radios in electric vehicles, even though automakers claim electric motors interfere with the signal.
title: Congress is trying to force carmakers to keep AM radio

description: The CBS News Confirmed team will be fact-checking claims made by Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz and Ohio Sen. JD Vance as they debate in New York City. CBS News Confirmed executive editor Rhona Tarrant breaks down the process.
title: Fact-checking process for Tim Walz, JD Vance debate

description: Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz and Ohio Sen. JD Vance have been preparing extensively for the vice presidential debate before the November election. CBS News Chief White House correspondent Nancy Cordes breaks down what to expect.
title: Tim Walz, JD Vance set to debate. What to know.

description: Dockworkers are walking picket lines at major East and Gulf coast ports, with consumers likely to feel the impact in coming weeks should it continue.
title: Port strike's impact: fewer bananas, pricier whiskey and chocolate

description: Air Force Maj. Gen. Pat Ryder, a Pentagon spokesperson, briefed reporters after Iran's missile attack against Israel Tuesday. Ryder underscored the U.S. will take action if Iran targets American assets in the region, and he reiterated conversations continue with Israel about next steps. CBS News contributor Sam Vinograd and Middle East analyst Courtney Kealy have more.
title: Pentagon reacts to Iran missile attack against Israel

description: Researchers used observations from the Webb Telescope to identify carbon dioxide and hydrogen peroxide on the surface of Charon, Pluto's largest moon.
title: Webb telescope detects carbon dioxide on surface of Pluto's largest moon

description: Credit card rates are sitting at a record high, but there may be ways to lower yours and save money on interest.
title: 4 easy ways to lower your credit card interest rates this October

description: National security adviser Jake Sullivan says nearly 200 ballistic missiles were launched toward Israel by Iran. Sullivan called the attack a significant escalation and praised U.S.-Israel coordination to intercept the missiles. CBS News contributor Sam Vinograd has more on the U.S. response.
title: White House reacts to Iran missile attack against Israel

description: The U.S. helped intercept missiles launched toward Israel by Iran, a defense official tells CBS News. Charlie D'Agata has more on U.S. involvement in the Middle East.
title: U.S. intercepted some missiles Iran launched at Israel, defense official says

description: Claudia Sheinbaum's presidential victory came 70 years after women won the right to vote in Mexico.
title: Claudia Sheinbaum takes office as Mexico's first female president

description: Iran's mission to the United Nations issued a statement confirming the missile attack launched toward Israel, calling it a "legal, rational, and legitimate response to the terrorist acts of the Zionist regime." CBS News' Robert Berger, Chris Livesay and Olivia Gazis have more.
title: Iranian attack on Israel is over, Iran's mission to the United Nations says

description: Iran has confirmed through its United Nations mission that it launched a missile attack against Israel. The Israel Defense Forces and the U.S. say they intercepted some of the missiles, but Iranian media is touting the attack as a success, CBS News senior foreign correspondent Elizabeth Palmer reports from Tel Aviv.
title: How will Iran's missile attack against Israel alter Middle East tensions

description: Iran confirmed it launched an attack toward Israel Tuesday as Israel's operations against Hezbollah in Lebanon escalate. Retired Lieutenant General H.R. McMaster, a former national security adviser, joins CBS News with his take on U.S. response to Iran's latest escalation in the region.
title: U.S. should consider response to Iran's attack, former national security adviser says

description: Police said two suspects were killed after opening fire on a boulevard in the Jaffa neighborhood in southern Tel Aviv.
title: 6 killed in Tel Aviv shooting moments before missile attack by Iran

description: John Amos was best known for his roles in "Roots" and the 1970s sitcom "Good Times."
title: John Amos, "Roots" and "Good Times" actor, dies at 84

description: Iran has launched missiles toward Israel, the Israel Defense Forces say. Sirens in Tel Aviv and Jerusalem warned Israelis to shelter in place. The U.S. is assisting Israel with missile interceptions, according to a defense official, while President Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris monitor the situation in the Middle East. Errol Barnett anchored CBS News' special report.
title: Israel intercepting Iran missiles, IDF says | Special Report

description: If you need an inexpensive way to borrow money, a home equity loan could make sense this October. Here's why.
title: Should you open a home equity loan this October?

description: The company's nonprofit arm is partnering with local organizations to place displaced residents in free housing on a short-term basis.
title: Airbnb giving Hurricane Helene victims free temporary housing

description: With credit card rates at record highs, you may want to pursue this type of debt relief now. Here's how to do it.
title: 3 ways to have your credit card debt forgiven this October

description: Hurricane Helene caused widespread devastation throughout the Southeast after making landfall in Florida.
title: How to help Hurricane Helene survivors

description: The benefits a gold investment offers can be particularly advantageous for beginners this October. Here's what to know.
title: Why beginners should invest in gold this October

description: The Israel Defense Forces is warning Israelis to shelter in place as news of missiles apparently launched from Iran emerges. CBS News' Willie James Inman has more from the White House where President Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris have been monitoring tensions in the region. Also, CBS News contributor Robert Berger has more from Jerusalem.
title: Israelis seek shelter after Iran launches missiles, IDF says

description: A long-term CD offers savers a safe way to earn high returns. Here's why it's worth opening one this October.
title: Why you should open a long-term CD this October

description: The Israel Defense Forces says missiles were launched from Iran towards the State of Israel. Warning sirens blared in Tel Aviv Tuesday night, and President Biden, Vice President Kamala Harris and the national security team convened before Iran's apparent strike. CBS News' Willie James Inman has more from the White House.
title: Iran fired missiles at Israel, IDF says

description: A high school student on her way to drill team practice is found murdered on campus. What it took to close the case after 30 years. "48 Hours" contributor Natalie Morales reports Saturday, Oct. 5 at 9/8c on CBS and streaming on Paramount+.
title: Sneak peek: The Hunt for Sarah Yarborough’s Killer

description: Rivers Cuomo and Patrick Wilson, the two remaining original members, revisited their 1994 debut album as part of their "Voyage to the Blue Planet" tour.
title: Weezer reflect on 30 years of "The Blue Album"

description: Home equity rates are dropping. If you're planning to borrow $150,000, here's what you can expect to pay monthly.
title: How much will a $150,000 home equity loan cost per month now that rates are falling?

description: The CBS Broadcast Center in New York City will play host to Tuesday night's debate between Tim Walz and JD Vance, the only debate scheduled for the vice presidential candidates in the 2024 campaign. CBS News Newspath correspondent Jarred Hill has a look at some of the security measures in place for the event.
title: Inside some of the security precautions for Vance-Walz VP debate

description: Haitian immigrants in Springfield, Ohio, have become a focal point of the 2024 campaign due to comments from both JD Vance and Donald Trump. Ahead of Vance's debate with Tim Walz, CBS News immigration and politics reporter Camilo Montoya-Galvez summarizes what's been said and the effect the comments have had.
title: Recapping Vance's comments about Haitian immigrants before debate with Walz

description: CBS News visited Plains, Georgia, for an inside look at the political outsider's security detail on his 100th birthday.
title: Jimmy Carter's Secret Service detail reflects on the assignment of a lifetime

description: Vice presidential candidates Tim Walz and JD Vance will face off Tuesday night in their only scheduled debate of the 2024 campaign. CBS News political correspondent Caitlin Huey-Burns has more on how Walz is getting ready.
title: How Tim Walz is preparing for debate with JD Vance

description: A senior White House official says that the U.S. believes Iran is preparing to imminently launch a missile attack against Israel and warns that should there be an attack, Iran will face consequences. CBS News White House reporter Willie James Inman and CBS News senior national security correspondent Charlie D'Agata have the latest.
title: White House warns direct attack from Iran against Israel will have severe consequences

description: A school bus fire in Bangkok has killed at least 25 students and teachers who officials say were on board for a school trip when the fire erupted. The students reportedly range from elementary to junior high school age with officials saying there were 44 people on the bus in total. A rescuer who responded to the scene says a tire explosion likely sparked the deadly fire.
title: At least 25 killed in Bangkok school bus fire

description: President Joe Biden said Monday there were reports that 600 people were unaccounted for after Hurricane Helene.
title: Race to find Helene survivors as officials fear death toll will rise

description: Five days after Helene tore through the Southeast, rescue workers are still searching for hundreds who remain missing and millions of people remain without power. CBS News correspondent Skyler Henry has more.
title: Helene survivors calling for supplies, say they didn't expect conditions to deteriorate so badly

description: CVS said it is cutting 2,900 workers, or about 1% of its workforce, as part of an effort to reduce costs by $2 billion.
title: CVS lays off 2,900 workers in cost-cutting move. Here's what to know.

description: Nearly half of all U.S. imports are at a standstill during a labor contract standoff between dockworkers and companies with at least 25,000 union workers at East Coast and Gulf Coast ports on strike. CBS News senior transportation correspondent Kris Van Cleave has more.
title: What to know about major U.S. dockworker strike

description: CBS News' Norah O'Donnell and Margaret Brennan are moderating Tuesday's vice presidential debate in New York.
title: Meet the moderators for tonight's VP debate, Norah O'Donnell and Margaret Brennan

description: A senior White House official says the U.S. has indications that Iran is planning to imminently launch a missile attack on Israel. This comes as Israel says its forces have begun targeted ground operations inside Lebanon, marking a dramatic escalation in the country's offensive against the Hezbollah militant group. CBS News foreign correspondent Chris Livesay has more.
title: Iran planning "imminent" attack on Israel, U.S. official says

description: As Israel escalates its fight with Iran's Hezbollah allies in Lebanon, a U.S. official says there are indications Iran is set to strike back.
title: U.S. official says Iran preparing for ballistic missile attack on Israel

description: The Emmy-winning comedian and former "SNL" star joins "CBS Mornings" to discuss her first book, "The Millicent Quibb School of Etiquette for Young Ladies of Mad Science," a young readers' adventure about three sisters and a mad scientist.
title: Kate McKinnon on writing her debut novel and life after SNL

description: Vice presidential candidates Tim Walz and JD Vance will face off in their only debate of the 2024 campaign Tuesday night at 9pm Eastern on CBS and Paramount+. CBS News campaign reporter Aaron Navarro has a preview.
title: Start time and other details for Walz and Vance's VP debate

description: On this edition of CBS Mornings Deals, shows us items that might just become essentials in your everyday life. Visit cbsdeals.com to take advantage of these exclusive deals today. CBS earns commissions on purchases made through cbsdeals.com.
title: Exclusive discounts from CBS Mornings Deals

description: Nearly 25 years after "The Tipping Point" became a cultural phenomenon, Malcolm Gladwell returns with his latest work, "Revenge of the Tipping Point."
title: Malcolm Gladwell talks new book and revisiting "The Tipping Point"

description: Weezer's debut album, known for hits like "The Sweater Song" and "Buddy Holly," is now 30 years old. The band reflects on their breakthrough success and how the album continues to resonate with fans decades later.
title: Weezer on marking 30 years for its iconic "Blue" album

description: A grizzly bear was killed Monday during a fight with another bear in Alaska's Katmai National Park.
title: Bear death caught on camera postpones Fat Bear Week plans

description: Sony's PlayStation Network went down, frustrating gamers around the world who complain they weren't able to sign in to their accounts.
title: Sony PlayStation Network outage throws gamers into hourslong disarray

description: Jesse Ashlock from Condé Nast Traveler joins "CBS Mornings" to unveil the 2024 Readers' Choice Awards, featuring the best vacation spots around the world, whether you're planning a family getaway or a solo escape.
title: Condé Nast traveler reveals top vacation destinations for 2024

description: With millions of pigeons still inhabiting New York City, today's "Mornings Memory" takes us back to 1963 when CBS News reported on the growing debate over how to manage the city's iconic birds.
title: Mornings Memory: The great NYC pigeon debate of 1963

description: As health care remains a top concern for voters, Dr. Jon LaPook discusses what to expect from Vice President Harris and former President Trump's health care plans during the upcoming debate.
title: Dr. Jon LaPook on health care questions facing VP debate candidates

description: Former Ambassador Susan Rice talks about why the vice presidency is a key position in American government and why voters should pay attention to the candidates.
title: Former Ambassador Susan Rice on the vital role of the vice president

description: During a press conference Monday in Georgia focused on the aftermath of Hurricane Helene, former President Donald Trump falsely claimed that the Biden administration had not spoken with Georgia Governor Brian Kemp about what the state needs for recovery efforts. CBS News campaign reporters Libby Cathey and Aaron Navarro have more.
title: Trump falsely claims Biden administration hasn't spoken with Georgia governor about Helene

description: Israeli troops cross into Lebanon in a dramatic escalation. Also, the death toll from Helene has climbed, and many people are still missing. All that and all that matters in today's Eye Opener.
title: Eye Opener: Israeli troops cross into Lebanon

description: Kayla Donnelly was at her bachelorette party in North Carolina when Helene hit and trapped her and her friends for three days on a mountain. Donnelly joined CBS News to describe her ordeal.
title: Survivor describes getting stranded on mountain by Helene during bachelorette party

description: New York Rep. Elise Stefanik, a top Republican in the House and supporter of former President Donald Trump, speaks with "CBS Mornings" about the only vice presidential debate between Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz and Sen. JD Vance.
title: GOP Rep. Elise Stefanik on VP debate

description: At least 25,000 union dockworkers are on strike in the Eastern and Southern U.S. after talks between the International Longshoremen's Association and shipping companies failed to reach a new contract. The union representing the dockworkers is seeking higher pay and protections against automation replacing workers.
title: Thousands of port workers go on strike, shutting down East and Gulf Coast ports

description: Tuesday marks former President Jimmy Carter's 100th birthday. No other U.S. president has ever lived as long. CBS News correspondent Nicole Sganga shows the stories of Secret Service special agents that have been part of a group protecting the 39th president for nearly half a century.
title: How Secret Service special agents have protected Jimmy Carter for nearly half a century

description: Tuesday night, CBS News will host the first and only vice presidential debate between Kamala Harris' running mate, Tim Walz, and Donald Trump's running mate, JD Vance. CBS News' Fin Gomez has a preview of the matchup and Danielle Alvarez, senior adviser to the Trump campaign, joined CBS News to discuss Vance's game plan.
title: What to know about VP debate between Walz, Vance

description: CBS News correspondent Nancy Cordes and chief election and campaign correspondent Robert Costa break down what to know about the VP debate between Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz and Sen. JD Vance.
title: What to expect as Walz, Vance face off in only scheduled VP debate hosted by CBS News

description: Hurricane Helene is now blamed for more than 130 deaths in the southeast, and the death toll is expected to rise. Days after the historic storm, rescue crews in western North Carolina are still struggling to clear damaged roads and help people in some of the hardest-hit areas.
title: Communities struggle to cleanup from historic Hurricane Helene as the death toll rises

description: Vice President Kamala Harris toured FEMA headquarters Monday and spoke to the governors of North Carolina and Georgia by phone about the federal help being offered to areas devastated by Hurricane Helene. Meanwhile, former President Donald Trump visited Georgia to see the damage there and falsely accused President Biden of not speaking with Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp.
title: Harris briefed by FEMA while Trump tours damage of Hurricane Helene in Georgia

description: The Israeli military says it has begun a "limited, localized" ground operation against Hezbollah targets in southern Lebanon. It comes after two weeks of heavy bombing targeting Hezbollah leadership.
title: Israeli military says it's beginning limited ground operations in Lebanon against Hezbollah

description: Thousands of dockworkers went on strike just after midnight on Tuesday as they rally for higher pay and more job security. The strike was expected to involve 25,000 workers, according to USMX, and close 14 ports. The strike threatens to drive up prices for consumers.
title: Thousands of dockworkers walk off the job. Here's how the strike could impact the economy

description: The North Carolina State Climate Office explains how the "monster storm" left unprecedented damage that will likely "take years to document."
title: Helene "close to a worst-case scenario" for western North Carolina

description: Verizon has a recommendation for people still having trouble getting service on their mobile phones after a massive outage.
title: Verizon's network is back up. Here's a fix if your phone isn't working.

description: Mortgage interest rates are dropping. Here's how to find the best one this October, according to some experts.
title: How to find the best mortgage rate this October, according to experts

description: Home equity loan rates have been falling and they could drop again in October. Here's what borrowers should know.
title: Here's the home equity loan interest rate forecast for October

description: On January 20, 1977, Georgia's Jimmy Carter was sworn in as the 39th president of the United States. "This inauguration ceremony marks a new beginning, a new dedication within our government, and a new spirit among us all. A president may sense and proclaim that new spirit, but only a people can provide it," said Carter during his inaugural address.
title: From the archives: Jimmy Carter's oath of office and inauguration speech

description: Israel says troops are entering Lebanon for "limited, localized, and targeted ground raids" against Hezbollah. Here's what to know.
title: Why Israel says it must go after Hezbollah on the ground in Lebanon

description: Former President Jimmy Carter turned 100 years old today. Back in 2010, Carter showed Lesley Stahl around his home for a 60 Minutes profile and told her how he filled out his days.
title: Inside Jimmy Carter's office | 60 Minutes

description: Vice presidential candidates Gov. Tim Walz and Sen. JD Vance are poised to go head-to-head at their first and only debate, hosted by CBS News.
title: How to watch the VP debate between Tim Walz and JD Vance

description: 1 Observatory Circle in northwest D.C. has been home for vice presidents from Walter Mondale to Kamala Harris.
title: Where does the VP live? Inside the second-in-command's official house

description: Recent polls show Kamala Harris' advantage over Donald Trump among Latinos is smaller than Joe Biden's was in 2020.
title: Harris courts Latinos with health care-focused ads slamming Trump

description: Arthur "Jack" Schubarth allegedly used tissue and testicles from large sheep hunted in Central Asia and the U.S. to create hybrid sheep for captive trophy hunting.
title: Man gets prison for cloning giant sheep for captive trophy hunting

description: On "60 Minutes: A Second Look," a new podcast, former Secret Service agent Clint Hill remembers his emotional interview with Mike Wallace in 1975 about the assassination of President John F. Kennedy.
title: JFK's Secret Service agent reflects on presidents' assassination

description: A bus carrying young students with their teachers caught fire in suburban Bangkok and more than 20 of those on board were feared dead, officials and rescuers said.
title: More than 20 feared dead in school bus fire in Thailand

description: The Al Madinah Region Development Authority leads the way for the city’s future with a focus on sustainable, human-centric development, enhancing quality of life while preserving the cultural and historical heritage of the ancient city.
title: Al Madinah: A Smart, Sustainable City without equal

description: Masdar City is driving Abu Dhabi's Falcon Economy and sustainable future. As a free zone and real estate developer, the City is a global hub for innovation, attracting industry leaders in energy, life sciences, agri-tech, space tech, mobility, and AI.
title: Masdar City: Pioneering Abu Dhabi’s Vision for a Sustainable and Diversified Economy

description: Gov. Tim Walz signed a law in 2020 that goes further to cut costs than other state laws. Now, former President Donald Trump and Vice President Kamala Harris are vying for support from people with diabetes.
title: Harris and Trump talk about insulin cost, but a law Walz signed does more

description: Former President Jimmy Carter has defied the odds in hospice care and reached his 100th birthday.
title: Jimmy Carter turns 100, the first former president to do so

description: John Dickerson reports on the devastation left behind by Hurricane Helene, the intensifying conflict between Israel and Hezbollah in Lebanon, and final preparations for the first and only vice presidential debate of 2024.
title: 9/30: The Daily Report with John Dickerson

description: Japan's parliament formally elected Shigeru Ishiba as the country's prime minister to replace Fumio Kishida, whose administration was rocked by scandals.
title: Shigeru Ishiba elected as Japan's next prime minister by Parliament

description: Thousands of dockworkers at ports along the East and Gulf Coasts are going on strike in search of higher pay and better job security.
title: Dockworkers begin strike at East and Gulf Coast ports

description: Southeast ravaged by catastrophic flooding from Helene; Spotlight on home hospice care as Jimmy Carter turns 100
title: 9/30: CBS Evening News
